Who we are: Different Health is a high-performance health company for people who expect more. We bring clinical-grade health optimization into the workplace—so high performers don’t have to choose between working hard and staying healthy. We make elite diagnostics and personalized plans radically more accessible, right where people spend their time: the office. Our platform enables companies to offer personalized health testing and insights—covering everything from nutrition to recovery and resilience—designed to optimize both well-being and performance. We’re growing fast, with a passionate, cross-disciplinary team, and are now looking for a

Senior Full-Stack Engineer to join us in building the future of proactive healthcare.
About the Role

As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer, you’ll own the end-to-end development of product features that drive real impact for our clients and their teams:
• Frontend: Build responsive, accessible interfaces using Next.js, TypeScript, and SCSS.
• Backend: Design and implement APIs and services using Fastify and Node.js.
• Infrastructure: Deploy, monitor, and scale our platform on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
• Databases: Model and work with non-relational databases like MongoDB or similar.

You’ll work closely with product, design, and other engineers to deliver high-quality, data-driven features that help users take control of their health.
Tech Stack

Frontend: Next.js, TypeScript, SCSS

Backend: Node.js, Fastify

Databases: MongoDB, Firestore, or similar

Cloud: Google Cloud Platform

DevOps: CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Cron jobs, Terraform (optional)

Tools: Bitbucket, GitHub, Linear, Slack, etc.

AI: Cursor, Claude Code, Gemini CLI, agents, etc.
What You’ll Bring
• 3+ years of experience in web development, ideally in fast-paced SaaS or health-tech environments.
• Proficiency with TypeScript, React / Next.js, Node.js, and SCSS.
• Experience with Fastify or similar backend frameworks.
• Solid understanding of non-relational databases.
• Experience with cloud infrastructure, especially Google Cloud Platform.
• Familiarity with software architecture principles (e.g., Clean Architecture, DDD).
• A strong product mindset—you care about the why behind the what.

Bonus Points
• Experience in fast-growing startups or early-stage teams.
• Experience working in or with wellness.
• Passion for testing (unit / integration / e2e).

Short-Term Goals

In your first few months, you'll focus on high-impact initiatives that will strengthen the foundation of our platform and accelerate delivery:
• Improve the visual design and UX.
• Elevate the interface quality and ensure consistency across all user journeys.
• Implement access control and user roles, setting up granular permissions to support enterprise use cases.
• Strengthen security controls, reviewing and enhancing security practices to ensure compliance and user trust.

What We Offer

Competitive salary (TBD by location). 100% remote work available. Subsidized wellness perks. The opportunity to help shape the future of preventive health.
Hiring Process

We move fast and value your time. Our goal is to wrap up the process within 2 weeks:
• Intro Call (30 min)
• Small project (1-3 hours)
• Call to discuss the reasoning behind your work (30 min)
• Final interviews (60 min)

• You will work very closely with your delivery team, typically comprising analysts, Quality Engineers and other Engineers, to deliver your joint project goals

• You will also work closely with other delivery teams and colleagues across the business, to ensure the overall project goals are successfully delivered
• You may be asked to discuss project matters with our clients
• Your engineering team lead will meet with you regularly to discuss your personal progress against objectives and development plan.

• UI Regression Testing Framework (Playwright)

• GitHub

• Yoodoo - You can go offline and spend 2 hours of your work time every week on any activity that serves your mental or physical health
• You will get 25 days paid Annual Leave per annum

• Paid maternity leave
• Paid paternity leave
• Paid sick leave
• Union - who provide assistance and service to everyone at VDP

About VDP

Founded 12 years ago in the UK, our company has a worldwide team that offers technology services.

We help various clients, including those without their own developers. For them, we build entire teams to develop software from the ground up. We also assist clients who already have platforms and development teams but need help speeding up their work or starting new projects.

Our skills include a broad range of technologies such as C#, Python, C++, Angular, React, Node.js, and both native and hybrid app development, as well as AI. Since we started, we have always worked remotely, so we don’t have an office, and everyone works from home.

We are a certified B Corp and have proven we are a force for good for our Employees, our Customers, our suppliers, our Communities and the Environment.

10% of what we make goes to our VDP Trust, helping to support projects for Women and Girls around the world.

Through our work, our values and our actions, we aim to be a force for good, not just for ourselves and our customers, but for our communities and the world at large.

We have four values that we all live by : Collaborate, Compassion, Honesty, and Inclusion.

Ingeniero de Software III (SWE-III)

Omega Enterprise Solutions es una pequeña empresa propiedad de veteranos discapacitados en servicio (SDVOSB) con sede en Maryland con un enfoque especial en la misión del Departamento de Defensa de los EE. UU. (DoD) y la Comunidad de Inteligencia (IC) y las tecnologías habilitadoras. Estamos construyendo un equipo con valores compartidos y pasión por nuestra Visión y Misión. Además de brindar oportunidades de crecimiento profesional que son innovadoras y desafiantes y de misión crítica para nuestros clientes, enfatizamos un enfoque diario centrado en la vida. Estamos comprometidos con el aprendizaje permanente y brindamos un método de gestión de coaching de vida para empoderarlo e inspirarlo a convertirse en la mejor versión de sí mismo en la búsqueda de una vida feliz, saludable y satisfactoria.

Descripción

El ingeniero de software (SWE) diseña, desarrolla, mantiene, mejora y documenta los sistemas de software. Dependiendo de la función, el nivel de habilidad y la complejidad del sistema del SWE, el SWE puede realizar todas o algunas de estas funciones. En los niveles más bajos, la SWE puede trabajar bajo estrecha supervisión como miembro de un equipo utilizando especificaciones bien definidas para desarrollar o mantener sistemas no complejos. En los niveles más altos, los SWE pueden trabajar de forma independiente o en un papel técnico principal, desarrollando la arquitectura y los requisitos del sistema, definiendo procesos y metodologías, resolviendo cuestiones técnicas complejas o problemas de investigación, y pueden tener la responsabilidad de dirigir las actividades de software de un programa grande.

Habilidades

• Analizar los requisitos del sistema para derivar los requisitos funcionales y de rendimiento del software
• Ayudar en el desarrollo de un diseño de software a partir de los requisitos o especificaciones del software
• Desarrollar software que cumpla con los requisitos funcionales y de rendimiento del sistema
• Ayudar con el desarrollo y ejecución de procedimientos de prueba de integración para componentes de software
• Practicar la calidad del software mediante el uso de herramientas o procesos (por ejemplo, análisis de código estático, cobertura de código, programación entre pares)
• Contribuir a la documentación del software del proyecto
• Desarrollar software de acuerdo con una metodología de desarrollo de software estructurada (por ejemplo, Agile, Spiral, Extreme, etcétera).

Calificaciones

Este puesto requiere una autorización de seguridad activa adecuada y un polígrafo.

Se requiere una Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Computación o una disciplina relacionada (Nota 1). También se requieren seis (6) años de experiencia como ingeniero de software, o se requiere una Maestría en Ciencias de la Computación o una disciplina relacionada (Nota 1). Who we are: Different Health is a high-performance health company for people who expect more. We bring clinical-grade health optimization into the workplace—so high performers don’t have to choose between working hard and staying healthy. We make elite diagnostics and personalized plans radically more accessible, right where people spend their time: the office. Our platform enables companies to offer personalized health testing and insights—covering everything from nutrition to recovery and resilience—designed to optimize both well-being and performance. We’re growing fast, with a passionate, cross-disciplinary team, and are now looking for a

Senior Full-Stack Engineer to join us in building the future of proactive healthcare.
About the Role

As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer, you’ll own the end-to-end development of product features that drive real impact for our clients and their teams:
• Frontend: Build responsive, accessible interfaces using Next.js, TypeScript, and SCSS.
• Backend: Design and implement APIs and services using Fastify and Node.js.
• Infrastructure: Deploy, monitor, and scale our platform on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
• Databases: Model and work with non-relational databases like MongoDB or similar.

You’ll work closely with product, design, and other engineers to deliver high-quality, data-driven features that help users take control of their health.
Tech Stack

Frontend: Next.js, TypeScript, SCSS

Backend: Node.js, Fastify

Databases: MongoDB, Firestore, or similar

Cloud: Google Cloud Platform

DevOps: CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Cron jobs, Terraform (optional)

Tools: Bitbucket, GitHub, Linear, Slack, etc.

AI: Cursor, Claude Code, Gemini CLI, agents, etc.
What You’ll Bring
• 3+ years of experience in web development, ideally in fast-paced SaaS or health-tech environments.
• Proficiency with TypeScript, React / Next.js, Node.js, and SCSS.
• Experience with Fastify or similar backend frameworks.
• Solid understanding of non-relational databases.
• Experience with cloud infrastructure, especially Google Cloud Platform.
• Familiarity with software architecture principles (e.g., Clean Architecture, DDD).
• A strong product mindset—you care about the why behind the what.

Bonus Points
• Experience in fast-growing startups or early-stage teams.
• Experience working in or with wellness.
• Passion for testing (unit / integration / e2e).

Short-Term Goals

In your first few months, you'll focus on high-impact initiatives that will strengthen the foundation of our platform and accelerate delivery:
• Improve the visual design and UX.
• Elevate the interface quality and ensure consistency across all user journeys.
• Implement access control and user roles, setting up granular permissions to support enterprise use cases.
• Strengthen security controls, reviewing and enhancing security practices to ensure compliance and user trust.

What We Offer

Competitive salary (TBD by location). 100% remote work available. Subsidized wellness perks. The opportunity to help shape the future of preventive health.
Hiring Process

We move fast and value your time. Our goal is to wrap up the process within 2 weeks:
• Intro Call (30 min)
• Small project (1-3 hours)
• Call to discuss the reasoning behind your work (30 min)
• Final interviews (60 min)

About Us

Innovation. Sustainability. Productivity. This is how we are Breaking New Ground in our mission to sustainably advance the noble work of farmers and builders everywhere. With a growing global population and increased demands on resources, our products are instrumental to feeding and sheltering the world.

From developing products that run on alternative power to productivity-enhancing precision tech, we are delivering solutions that benefit people – and they are possible thanks to people like you. If the opportunity to build your skills as part of a collaborative, global team excites you, you’re in the right place.

Grow a Career. Build a Future!

Be part of this company at the forefront of agriculture and construction, that passionately innovates to drive customer efficiency and success. And we know innovation can’t happen without collaboration. So, everything we do at CNH Industrial is about reaching new heights as one team, always delivering for the good of our customers.

Job Purpose

We are currently seeking an Senior Firmware Software Engineer to join our organization. CNH is designing a next generation core software solution. Core software typically includes middle layer, lower layer embedded software, RTOS, bootloader, cybersecurity stack for electronic control unit (ECU). Core software needs to meet stringent real time and performance requirements. The developed core software is integrated with application software. As a Senior Firmware Software Engineer, you will be responsible for design, development, and third part integrations of cybersecurity stack.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop new generation core software solution catered for automotive grade real time ECUs.
• Cybersecurity Software Design and development
• Benchmark and select suitable third-party software components, microcontrollers etc.
• Lead software development tasks with Software suppliers, integrate and accept supplier provided software modules.
• Coordinate with internal requirements teams and derive software requirements.
• Configure and Integrate AUTOSAR - MCAL based drivers with legacy middle layer modules.
• Troubleshoot and fix bugs reported by HIL, product validation team or application software team during verification and validation cycle.
• Develop and maintain software documentation: SDD, SRS, API documentation, product functional spec etc.
• Design and develop tools to automate software workflows and processes.
• Define software configuration management to ensure effective software management.
• Ensure that software adheres to coding standards and meet stringent performance and safety requirements of real time embedded system.

Experience Required
• Bachelor’s degree in engineering or technical field with 5+ years of engineering experience.
• Experience of microcontrollers (16/32-bit automotive grade), HSM, compilers/linkers.
• Experience with embedded code debugging (call stack analysis, profiling, breakpoint evaluation, resource budget analysis as Flash, RAM, and CPU load).
• Experience with cybersecurity implementations (e.g. Secure Boot, Secure communication, Certificate management, Authentication, Intrusion Detection/Logging etc).
• Experience with CAN based protocols such as J1939, XCP, KWP, UDS, communication tools Vector CANalayser, CANape, CANoe, INCA or similar.
• Experience working with memories (Flash, EEPROM, RAM, External memories), MMU/MPU etc.
• Experience with software design and requirements documentation.
• US Citizenship will be required for this position.

Pay Transparency

​The annual salary for this role is $105,750 - $141,000 plus any applicable bonus (Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as skill, experience and qualification for the role.)

We offer dynamic career opportunities across an international landscape. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to delivering value for all our employees and fostering a culture of respect.

At CNH, we understand that the best solutions come from the diverse experiences and skills of our people. Here, you will be empowered to grow your career, to follow your passion, and help build a better future. To support our employees, we offer regional comprehensive benefits, including:
